resources:
***REMOVED*** General application strings --> Tap a card. Reading card… Do not move card Locked MIFARE Classic card Locked MIFARE Ultralight card Locked MIFARE DESFire card History No trips found. Has this card been used? Export Export Filename Preferences Balance %s Loading… Supported Cards ***REMOVED*** Translators: This is used for a total number of transactions that have been performed on the card. This is slightly different to a "trip counter", as many tickets count both the tap-on (entry) and tap-off (exit), as well as top-ups as different transactions. ***REMOVED***
No part of this card is freely readable without a key. You have no valid keys installed for it.\n\n If supported by SGCardReader, the card will work once keys are installed for it. These are generally different for each card. More info about acquiring and installing keys can be found in the documentation.\n\n If your card is not supported by SGCardReader, it is unlikely it will ever be, unless the key for it is deciphered.\n\n Please lobby the card issuer to allow open data access on issued cards. It is safe to permit open, read-only access to data with modern smartcard technology. Some agencies even provide open documentation about the data format!
Fully locked card. NFC off Please enable NFC to read card info. Wireless Settings ***REMOVED*** Translators: "Machine ID" is arbitrary. It could be a decimal number, or hexadecimal… --> Machine ID %s ***REMOVED*** Translators: "Machine ID" is arbitrary. It could be a decimal number, or hexadecimal… -->
***REMOVED*** TRANSLATORS: This is used on a list item, which will direct users to SGCardReader's website when touched. -->
Block: %s Page: 0x%s Application: %s File: %s File: %s (unauthorized) File: %1$s (invalid: %2$s) Page: 0x%s (unauthorized) Sector: 0x%s Sector: 0x%s (unauthorized) Sector: 0x%s (empty) Sector: 0x%1$s (invalid: %2$s) ***REMOVED*** Translators: the first parameter is a hexadecimal number. --> Record: %s Binary data Info ***REMOVED*** Translators: These are both dates, eg: "Valid from 3/12/2017 to 3/3/2018". Dates are formatted according to user preferences. --> Valid %1$s to %2$s ***REMOVED*** Translators: This is an end date, eg: "Valid until 3/3/2018". Dates are formatted according to user preferences. --> Valid until %1$s ***REMOVED*** Translators: This is a start date, eg: "Valid from 3/12/2017". Dates are formatted according to user preferences. --> Unknown (%s) Unknown Encryption keys are required to read this card. SGCardReader does not support keys for this type of card. Add Key Error Keys Delete Really delete key? ***REMOVED*** Translators: %1$s is a user supplied name for an encryption key. %2$s is a description of the type of key. This will be populated with a localised string (keytype_mfc or keytype_mfc_static). ***REMOVED*** The key file "%1$s" (containing %2$s) will be gone forever. ***REMOVED*** Translators: in this context, "key" refers to an encryption key --> Deleting keys is currently unavailable ***REMOVED*** Translators: in this context, "key" refers to an encryption key --> For safety reasons, you can\'t delete keys while card number obfuscation is enabled. Turn it off if you want to delete keys. No keys. NFC Unavailable General Launch from background This card is not supported by your device. Some station names are unknown. Report Beta version of card reader. ***REMOVED*** Translators: This is used to label a card's product name. For example, "Opal". -->
Select file File exported successfully.
About this card format Online services MIFARE Classic Authentication retries Number of times to attempt authentication for each sector
Some agencies have no identifying magic on their card. To read them, you must select an agency explicitly. Fallback reader ***REMOVED*** Shown as a preference description when a feature needs Android 5.0 or later. --> Requires Android 5.0 or later.
***REMOVED*** Obfuscation options --> Obfuscation Hide card numbers Don\'t show card numbers anywhere
Obfuscate balance Change the balance shown by a random amount
Obfuscate dates Show trip, expiry and scan dates as different, random days
Obfuscate times ***REMOVED*** TRANSLATORS: The meaning of "fuzz" in this context is "to randomise" --> Fuzz and reduce resolution of timestamps on trips, and scans
Obfuscate fares Change fares shown by a random amount
***REMOVED*** Accessibility options --> Accessibility
Speak balance aloud When you scan a card, the balance will be automatically read aloud. This works even when a screen reader is not running.
***REMOVED*** TRANSLATORS: "Place names" are proper nouns, eg: "Beijing", "Los Angeles", "Sydney", "Tokyo". ***REMOVED*** Add language hints to place names
***REMOVED*** TRANSLATORS: "LocaleSpan" is the name of an Android API, and should not be translated.
"station" in this context refers to a railway (train, light rail, tram, metro, subway) station. "stop" refers to a bus or ferry stop. "line" refers to the name of a railway (train, light rail, tram, metro, subway) line. "route name" refers to a name or identifier of a route that a bus or ferry follows.
This option is automatically disabled on Android versions that don't support it. ***REMOVED*** Adds language hints (LocaleSpan) to place names, such as station, stop, line and route names. This alters the pronunciation used by screen readers and other accessibility software.
***REMOVED*** TRANSLATORS: This directs users to a dialog with "localise_places_longdesc" showing more information about the option. ***REMOVED*** About language hints…
***REMOVED*** TRANSLATORS: This is shown as the title of the dialog for localise_places_longdesc. ***REMOVED*** About language hints
***REMOVED*** TRANSLATORS: Shown in a pop-up dialog, when "localise_places_longdesc_button" is pressed. "LocaleSpan" is the name of an Android API, and should not be translated. "Google TalkBack" is the name of Android's standard screen-reader software. ***REMOVED*** Text-to-speech voices normally only work well for one language.\n\nLocaleSpan hints are used to mark text as being in a different language. When applied to a station, stop, line or route name, a screen reader that supports these hints will pronounce the name using synthesized voices from the place\'s native language, rather than the language you have configured Android to use.\n\nEnabling this option generally improves the pronunciation of foreign place names that are not internationally renowned, but you might find it more difficult to understand.\n\nThis does not normally change the on-screen display of place names, but some devices may use a different font.\n\nThis requires accessibility software that supports the LocaleSpan API (such as Google TalkBack), and that you have appropriate voices installed.
***REMOVED*** Translators: This is shown when an unsupported type of card is scanned, and that we were unable to read it at all, let alone parse its content. --> Unsupported NFC card media
Saving card…
Reading MIFARE Classic card… Trying user-supplied key for sector %d… Trying alternate user-supplied keys for sector %d… Trying well-known keys for sector %d… Reading sector %d…
Detecting ISO 14443 card type… Reading MIFARE DESFire card… ***REMOVED*** Translators: This is substituted with the name of a card, like "Reading Opal…" or "Reading Suica…" --> Reading %s…
Detecting MIFARE Ultralight card type… Reading MIFARE Ultralight card… ***REMOVED*** Translators: This is substituted with the name of a card, like "Unlocking Leap card…" --> Unlocking %s card…
Probing ISO7816 card…
Card partially read!
The card went out of range while reading.\n\n Some data was read, but it might not be enough to get useful data.\n\n Thick cases and metal can interfere with NFC operation. Failure could also indicate that the card or your device\'s NFC antenna is damaged.
Show incomplete data
***REMOVED*** Translators: this is a short suffix for milliseconds, "%s" will display the number to one decimal place (in localized form). -->
***REMOVED*** Translators: shown in place of a real card number in some lists when obfuscation is enabled. ***REMOVED*** Hidden card number
Hidden key data (%d byte)
Hidden key data (%d bytes)
***REMOVED*** Translators: "key" is an encryption key, which is displayed below this label. --> Key data
***REMOVED*** Translators: There is an obfuscation mode, with many flags (options) available. The value "count" passed is the number of flags (options) that are turned on.
This is shown on the main window, instead of the "directions" string. ***REMOVED***
%d obfuscation flag on
%d obfuscation flags on
None (disabled)
SmartRider (WA, Australia), MyWay (ACT, Australia)
null
smartrider
Theme Choose look and feel
Dark
Light
FareBot
***REMOVED*** Translators: do not translate -->
dark
light
farebot
***REMOVED*** This tile server gives "retina" tiles which are much nicer on modern smartphones.
Metrodroid has been granted permission to use the tile server by the tile server operator. Other projects will need to explicitly seek permission from the tile server operator.
The tile stylesheets are available under an open source license at: https://github.com/stackunderflow-stackptr/stackptr_tools/tree/master/osm-bright
You may wish to replace this in other translations with a localised tile server in place of this one. ***REMOVED***
Show both local and English station names If enabled, both local and English names will be shown regardless of locale. If disabled, the most appropriate variant is chosen.
***REMOVED*** Translators: "block" is referring to a block of storage. -->
***REMOVED*** Translators: "record" is referring to structured unit of storage. -->
%d record
%d records
***REMOVED*** Translators: Felica divides cards up into a hierarchy with each card containing 1 or many system codes. Each system code contains 1 or many service codes. Each service code contains 1 or many blocks of data. -->
***REMOVED*** Translators: used as an accessibility label for a passengers icon -->
passenger
passengers
***REMOVED*** DESFire --> Standard file Backup file Value file Linear record Cyclic record Unknown file type Challenge Response Confirmation Key exchange Key %s

Type: %1$s, Length: %2$s bytes

Type: %1$s, Record: %2$s (%3$s maximum), Record Size: %4$s
Type: %1$s, Records: %2$s (%3$s maximum), Record Size: %4$s

Hardware Info Enabled Disabled
***REMOVED*** CEPAS hardware information --> CEPAS Version Purse ID Purse Status Purse Balance Date of Purse Creation Autoload Amount Info About Last Transaction Credit Header Debit Options Other Purse Info Logfile Record Count Issuer Data Length Issuer-specific Data Purse Info
***REMOVED*** Translators: This is shown below a trip entry to describe the start and end stations of a trip.
The %1$s is the starting station. The %2$s is the ending station.
Text within parentheses: ( ) Hidden on the display, and only sent to screen readers. This works with all supported versions of Android, and most screen readers. You can use this any number of times.
Text within square brackets: [ ] Shown on the display, and not sent to screen readers. This only works with Android 5.0 or later. It works with Talkback, but does not work with Select to Speak. Do not put words in here. You can use this any number of times.
Example: Source: "(From )Tokyo [→] (to )Osaka" Written: "Tokyo → Osaka" Spoken: "From Tokyo to Osaka" ***REMOVED*** (From )%1$s [→] (to )%2$s ***REMOVED*** Translators: it's used when departure point isn't known, eg: "to Central Station" --> to %s ***REMOVED*** Translators: it's used to show time in trip listing e.g. 12:35 - 12:51. The time will be formatted according to user preferences. ***REMOVED*** %1$s → %2$s ***REMOVED*** Translators: it's used when departure time isn't known. If "?" is the first character, it must be prefixed with "\". ***REMOVED*** \??:?? → %s
***REMOVED*** Locations --> Singapore
***REMOVED*** These strings are used for content descriptions (accessibility), for modes of transport. Using them for custom pages on individual operators is discouraged (eg: Opal), as strings and translations should match the terminology of the operator (eg: light rail vs. tram). ***REMOVED***
***REMOVED*** Used as descriptive text for the bus icon. --> Bus ***REMOVED*** Used as descriptive text for the train icon. --> Train ***REMOVED*** Used as descriptive text for the tram icon. --> Tram ***REMOVED*** Used as descriptive text for the metro icon. --> Metro ***REMOVED*** Used as descriptive text for the ferry icon. --> Ferry ***REMOVED*** Used as descriptive text for the ticket machine icon. --> Ticket Machine ***REMOVED*** Used as descriptive text for the vending machine icon. --> Vending Machine ***REMOVED*** Used as descriptive text for the point of sale icon. --> Point of Sale ***REMOVED*** Used as descriptive text for the banned icon. --> Banned ***REMOVED*** Used as descriptive text for the trolleybus icon. --> Trolleybus ***REMOVED*** Used as descriptive text for the unknown transit mode icon. --> Unknown
Bus #%s Bus Refund MRT Top-up First use Retail Purchase Service Charge
***REMOVED*** Go Card (South East Queensland/Brisbane, AU) These are deliberately separated strings in order to match the terminology of the agency. ***REMOVED*** Regular
***REMOVED*** Myki (Victoria, AU) These are deliberately separated strings in order to match the terminology of the agency. ***REMOVED*** Software Info Convert times to current timezone By default, SGCardReader displays travel times in the timezone of the transit agency. If this option is enabled, SGCardReader will convert travel times to your device\'s current timezone.
Expiry date
***REMOVED*** Translators: Some cards record the cardholder's gender, this is used to label the field. ***REMOVED***
***REMOVED*** En1545 and related cards -->
***REMOVED*** Translators: The name of the transit agency who sold a subscription --> ***REMOVED*** Translators: Attribute to describe the number of remaining trips on the card or subscription. -->
***REMOVED*** Translators: Used to describe a subscription (travel pass) made of single trips. -->
***REMOVED*** Translators "Last used" is a date, time or date+time attribute --> ***REMOVED*** Translators: Free as in "gratis" (costing no money) -->
***REMOVED*** Translators: This refers to a person's name. -->
***REMOVED*** Translators: This is used to describe whether a card is personalised (registered to an individual) or anonymous (not registered). ***REMOVED*** Card type
***REMOVED*** Translators: Used to describe a card that is not registered to any individual. --> ***REMOVED*** Translators: Used to describe a card that has been registered in an individual's name. -->
***REMOVED*** Translators: This should never be translated as "ZIP code". This string should not be used for ticketing systems in USA. ***REMOVED*** Blank MIFARE Ultralight card Blank MIFARE Classic card
This card is completely blank as far as we can tell. It is formatted but without any data written to it. It still has a serial number by which it can be uniquely identified and linked to a database but card itself contains no other data.
Blank card
***REMOVED*** Translators: T-money is Korean payment/transit system. Korean: 티머니 May be transliterated -->

***REMOVED*** Translators: Shown as a label for a group of keys that does not have any label or description. --> Untitled key group
%d static MIFARE Classic key
%d static MIFARE Classic keys
Static keys cannot be assigned to a single card.

eg: "Vehicle 1024", "Vehicle 2A10" ***REMOVED*** Vehicle %s Card ID ***REMOVED*** Translators: used as a preference category label, for settings related to the display of maps --> Map ***REMOVED***
